faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Расходы на приобретение недвижимости обычно составляют 8-10% of purchase price, comprising: 6% stamp duty (ITP), 1.2-1.5% notary and registry fees, 0.4-0.6% property registry costs, and legal representation fees (approximately 1%). However, Spanish mortgages often qualify for VAT (21%) rather than stamp duty, effectively reducing overall costs. Detailed cost breakdowns are provided during initial consultations with qualified legal advisors ensuring transparent purchasing processes.

faqs.question: Сколько составляет налог на недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Ежегодные налоги на недвижимость (IBI) typically represent 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value, often 30-50% below market values. This property's estimated annual property tax would likely range €1,200-1,800 based on local assessment values. Non-resident property owners may face additional annual tax obligations (non-resident income tax) on imputed rental values, though recent legislative changes have modified these requirements. Qualified accountants provide detailed tax planning guidance ensuring compliant and optimized tax positions.

faqs.question: Могу ли я получить ипотеку в Испании как иностранец?
faqs.answer: Да, нерезиденты Испании могут получить Spanish mortgages through major financial institutions. EU citizens typically access loans covering 60-80% of purchase price at competitive rates. Non-EU buyers may require larger deposits (20-30%) and additional documentation. Professional mortgage brokers specializing in international clients navigate regulatory requirements and identify optimal financing solutions aligned with individual circumstances. Interest rates remain competitive with international alternatives, particularly for longer loan terms.
